meanings.definition: The quality of being directive or tending to direct
meanings.sent1: Her directivity in leading the team to success was commendable.
meanings.sent2: The microphone's directivity allowed it to pick up sound from a specific direction.
meanings.sent3: The robot's directivity made it the bossy one among the toys.
meanings.sent4: His directivity in decision-making was like a compass guiding us through uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The directivity of the lighthouse beam ensured ships stayed on course.

meanings.definition: The property of a device or system that determines the direction in which it transmits or receives signals.
meanings.sent1: The antenna's directivity helped in receiving signals clearly.
meanings.sent2: The satellite dish's directivity was crucial for capturing TV broadcasts.
meanings.sent3: The directivity of the remote control was so strong, it changed channels on its own!
meanings.sent4: The directivity of the security camera kept a watchful eye on the entire area.
meanings.sent5: The directivity of the radar system pinpointed the exact location of the target.
